poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Trams to clang and sparkle stars That fizzle in sudden tarns. Alighting passengers consider Tines, the tangs or horns – toot, toot! – Of this one: do they jump Or miss their stop? Someone caulks and tars The coachwork, port and starboard, Touches up the passengers' Paleface tans. A trans Conductor keeping tabs On tickets. Their inspector Tags along.
